column4: [I'm on Karmic] - I just re-installed the package GDM and now I can't login to my main profile via X
anybody know what would keep a user from being able to login?
after I login, the screen flashes and then i'm led back to the GDM login screen
/why/ did you reinstall gdm?
I had accidentally uninstalled it when i targeted gvfs
gvfs for uninstall...
err.... why do you want to uninstall gvfs?
do you have gvfs installed at the moment or not?
idk, I jst had this thing about that ~/.gvfs folder and nothing being able to access it, debian works fine without it, so why not?
currently, no
I don't know too much about gvfs but gnome uses it for quite some things, and debian iirc has an older version of gnome, can you try to install ubuntu-desktop and see if that fixes your issue?
i dn't either and is one of the reasons I removed it :P
well, hard to debug then, looked at ~/.xsession-errors?
uhm... .xsession-errors just reports some missing file from a previous bashrc: `shopt not found' I just took those lines out
well, can you try to install ubuntu-desktop and see if you can login after that? If it does not just remove everything it installed again
ok, i just installed ubuntu-desktop and it looks like it has the other packages that were removed when I took out gvfs, so I'm going to try that
thanks much :)
ubuntu-desktop is a package that doesn't do anything except pull in everything that is needed to run the default ubuntu-desktop
so installing that should make sure that you have at least the original installation apps installed
yea, looks everything is back to normal, including gvfs :S but if it works i'm not going to mess with it again ... thanks again =)
yw
ok, so I think I found out why I'm not able to login with my main profile...
